intro: Echinospermum echinophorum, commonly known as the prickly poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is characterized by its spiny, lobed leaves and striking, showy yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant produces a capsule fruit that contains numerous small, hard seeds. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert or semi-arid environments. Botanically, it belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes other plants such as hibiscus and cotton.
